answers.answer: Hello Corkrin,We are volunteers here and not medical professionals, so I urge you to talk with your son's pediatrician about your concerns.  I agree that 274 sounds high, but even a person without diabetes can have a high reading -- depending on one's other health factors.Hormones, medication, stress, and recent meals will affect blood sugar, so it's important that you keep track of your son's overall info and share that with his doctor.  Also note mood, urination, hunger & thirst patterns.Since you're newly diagnosed, you might also be interested in visiting the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation website:  http://www.jdrf.org where there's a link to a more personal Online Diabetes Support Team.  Staffed with volunteers like us, they are also able to connect folks with others in your area.  Look for the link to Newly Diagnosed.Good luck and do follow up on Monday with the doctor.

question: I need to find out what the normal blood sugar level for a 14 year old should be.  I tested my son's blood sugar and the reading was 274.  I am newly diagnosed w/ diabetes and am pretty sure that this is not a safe reading.
title: Target Blood Sugar
